general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new commissioner, Shahn Chakarian, and encouraged him to introduce himself and his interests in sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed his pleasure to be part of the committee. He is a former engineer and current attorney in intellectual property. He has experience with inventions and technologies related to alternative fuels and sustainability, and is excited to help the city move forward in its goals towards greater sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the process for submitting a letter, referencing a previous letter introduced by former Commissioner Alec. She asked if a draft should be brought to a meeting or if it needed to be agendized.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed that she would like to agendize a letter about outreach that the commission could do to the community, including a speaker series and field trips.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Announced that one of the proposed projects, the prom teen clothing swap, will be held in about two weeks at the Glendale Central Library Teen Center and is being promoted through social media.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Stated that the Earth Day Fair would be discussed later in the agenda and that it was another part of the student commissioner projects that has now passed.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Shared more about the clothing swap, explaining that it is centered more on a teen audience to reach out to people their age to learn more about sustainable practices through a clothing swap. Since it's prom season, people are looking to buy dresses, and this would allow them to not spend as much.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if the clothing swap would be a venue to promote against fast fashion.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Explained that part of the proposal was to have some education against fast fashion. The student commissioners proposed the idea to have a different channel that wasn't subscribing to fast fashion. There will also be a tailor available to alter items, a photo booth, and a makeup artist for consultations. Goody bags donated by businesses will also be given out.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed that the clothing swap was very impressive.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged that we are living in a time where there are a lot of headwinds when it comes to sustainability and environmental work, especially at the federal level. He commended the commissioners and city staff for their continued work on these issues.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Wished former Sustainability Commissioner Alec Bartsosaf good luck on the Transportation Commission. She noted that he was one of the original commissioners and that his expertise will be missed. She wished him well on his next adventure.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Hoped that Alec would come and speak as needed, as his input would be valued.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated that she had a question about the Climate Action Adaptation Plan and noted that the link wasn't working. She asked if this was the negative declaration or the draft plan, and if the negative declaration was attached to it.

oral_communications.speaker: Alan Dish
oral_communications.comment: Expressed his concerns about the trees that were cut down in North Central at the development site. He asked the new mayor if stronger measures could be imposed, such as declaring a state of emergency, to put a ban on cutting any trees, especially the massive sequoias. He stated that the mayor gave a wonderful reply but could not do it because of the charter. He asked the commission to see what is in their capacity to pass some kind of recommendations to the city council. He stated that he is not so opposed to the form, in the sense that we are approaching a complex but urgent situation with ecology, fires, and developers, and that we may need to impose some stronger measures. He stated that the way to do it is with some kind of charismatic leader, because the people will not awaken spontaneously. He concluded by stating that even FDR was making certain decisions bypassing Congress, and that he is not so opposed to having a kind of mayoral power that can do those decisions. He stated that commissions play a very significant role.
